0.root_title: Posts Vs. Commenting? Which One Is More Important?
0.body:
![Posts vs Comments 2.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmeVGGAkKnUqdbrBKNWTzYgDqQPa2nE9YrTjsi3G2VUzAR/Posts%20vs%20Comments%202.png)

Yesterday a Steemian wrote in the comment section that he is a beginner here and that he is a bit confused because on the platform itself and on youtube people are saying different things about how to get successful on Steemit. 
_________
Or let us say: **How to start the journey right, getting more followers, and of course bigger financial rewards.** 
________

Is it better for a beginner to focus first on writing articles like this one, or to focus more on commenting? This question I will try to handle here.
_________

And again, there is no one best rule. 
What I am sharing with you is based on my experience and observation.

![Familiar with blogging.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmZh2crZaZQRAR8y5ShtJZJkFC2F9ugH7V1ViYNayyG2WK/Familiar%20with%20blogging.png)

This was my starting point. I was already familiar with blogging and writing that's why I focused directly on publishing my content. It was not that someone told me I was just led by my skills. 
_________

In this stage, I researched on this platform and also on youtube what other people are saying about some Steemit Hacks. ;) We all are looking for them, right?

I found out that commenting would bring more rewards and followers than publishing your own content. I tried it out.
________

Indeed comments brought me some new followers, but I didn't get higher rewards compared to my articles. I have to say that I tried to summon the rewards of many comments, not only from one compared to one article.
__________

In my case, I can say yes, I got more followers via commenting but the rewards were sobering. But again this was in my case, it has not to be in your situation. Maybe I was writing not great enough comments.

Some Steemian told me that he gained an attractive amount via comment rewards and also more follower compared to his articles. 

![Focus on what now?.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmWSpmCoN2V97ZMGDcVG9gi38xui7eAtq4arm7kR84283j/Focus%20on%20what%20now%3F.png)

I can't give you the best solution; this is something everyone has to find out for himself. But there is something I can definitely tell you; something that will work for sure. Curious? You have to wait a bit. First, I want to show you something more I observed here.
__________

I recognized that both actions, publishing articles and commenting brought two different types of followers out. 

![friends.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmQJMqR2u1jwoRko8KH46VCwoS7wnTbA48KCT1DampD9sT/friends.png)

Through meaningful comments, you build faster friendships here. Through these comments, conversation happens, and some of them will be shifted into the steemitchat where the conversation continues. 

Through comments, you make connections on a deeper basis.

For example: When a user sees you always bringing meaningful comments, he gets curious about you and upvotes you by time. Some upvotes arise just through sympathy.

This includes me also. When I see a person is commenting a lot, I am willing to reward her or him for that. Many authors are doing that. Through comments, you're making friends, and this is so important.

![Follower.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmVxY1CfUUWK4R3iJ8MUYfo3n2exsjnCcENpdsNNW7eSpE/Follower.png)

Through your published content you attract real followers.
What do I mean by that?
__________

People follow you because they have an interest in what you are sharing. They are interested in your voice. They believe they can get something valuable from you. This could be an advice, how they can make something better, or getting interesting information about a specific topic. It's like they are getting something to eat.
__________

This is more on a professional basis.
Don't get me wrong, I am not saying it is always like that, far away with that. 
_________

These people don't want to miss a post of you because they expect something valuable for themselves. Something they can implement into their own lives.

Let me try to explain it in another way.

![Friendship Brand.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmZUUbYK5DruUN1dZtrhSFdYnBoXZpxfvGaZCG419WEMbU/Friendship%20Brand.png)

**Through meaningful comments and everything that happens out of that, you are building friendships.** 

**Through your quality posts, you are building your brand**.
___________

Imagine an author looks on your blog because he saw you always posting great comments, but he sees no real structure in your blog. But he finds you sympathetic, and that's why he/she will follow you to support you in time which is great!
________

The other case is that he/she sees your blog and see that you are writing about something he is really interested in. He reads one post and discovers that he can learn a lot of you. He starts following you because of your skills in a particular topic.
___________

Am I saying its always that way? NO! Far Away with that.
I am just trying to draw a picture for a better understanding.

![What is more importnat now.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmbUfA2fJ1Z4bZnQ9n6xYJa8Z6ZivSVpKD6inChQZnvUDq/What%20is%20more%20importnat%20now.png)

I have a clear opinion about that.

**My answer is BOTH!**
And this is the best case, the best combination but also the hardest!

You need friends, who support you but you also need a brand which attractst followers. I would say that a brand is a bit stronger for the long run.

But it's hard to do both equally commenting a lot and writing interesting contributions, puhhh tough work. But this is, in my opinion, the best combination.

I don't know many people, but some people represent this type of user.
@charles1, for example, is one of them in my opinion.

![Bildschirmfoto 2017-12-21 um 17.58.10.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmYZUkRh4X8QdfXCA377gCUQXi9bnwLQWP9ZiNAGjE1DMq/Bildschirmfoto%202017-12-21%20um%2017.58.10.png)

Since June 2017 he is a member here.
Look at his number in the middle. This number represents the total amount of comments you made. He did so far over 13.000 friends.

Then take a look at his feed. I would say he is writing awesome stuff.
_________

I know my opinion is subjective some of you might disagree, and that's fine.

The second example for me is a user who is still no longer active here. But I hope that he will come back one day.

![Bildschirmfoto 2017-12-21 um 18.02.34.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmQ76rB5fMMM6ahCprwWXVRPJcDKtNF8Jz8E12TEmTbSc1/Bildschirmfoto%202017-12-21%20um%2018.02.34.png)

This guy has made a huge climb in a short amount of time, and his last activity in case of publishing is over two months ago and look what he achieved. When he would have done his road the last two months with the same intensity, he would be already on the Steemit moon! But it could also be that he pressed too hard an burned out. I hope not, but it could be.

By the way, he is until now the only one who could fight against me regarding thumbnails in my opinion :D (just kidding)

![Conclusion 2.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmcQceJ37RB87kwmPUbixEh2YRxQhzTgX4ogWrtjPKB2MP/Conclusion%202.png)

Like I said there is no best way or rule to achieve the goal you've set. But we can say that both commenting and posting are essential. Which weight you give to both it's up to you. 

But what I would recommend is this:

Start with that where you feel more comfortable with. Don't stress yourself. Play around and see how you find yourself in this ocean. Make some experiments and observe the output. And again don't stress yourself. This site is still young and the fact that you are already here gives you an advantage.

![Follow Upvote resteem png.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmU6C6NQ5wAwy3mpVBqTVp7oQeLadkJQbEy4p8Bsk7ktj4/Follow%20Upvote%20resteem%20png.png)
0.title: Posts Vs. Commenting? Which One Is More Important?
0.author: modernpastor

0.root_title: What Is The Best Posting Frequency On Steemit? Here's What I Think!
0.body:
![Posting Thumnb.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmXwDeP5XsFsz8tQFe9FimVJLE4d1J4gbMZDDLbb6iC6Uj/Posting%20Thumnb.png)

What is the best posting frequency on Steemit?
This question I will handle in this Post.
__________

When we get to know this platform all of us are still learning about it. It doesn't matter if you are a minnow, dolphin or whale. This platform brings in irregular intervals new features, and often these new features are bringing something new to learn about it to get the most out of this platform. This counts for all of us. 
_________

One of those questions to get the most out of Steemit is for example: **What is the most beneficial posting frequency?**

Let me tell you right up front: **There is no one best rule!**
_________

It depends on different factors like mostly our circumstances in our private lives. We have all different starting points, and we need to be aware of that. It would be misleading to compare yourself to someone who is quite longer than you on this platform or even a full-time steemian.

But what we can do for now is to ignore all these different circumstances and trying to answer this question from a neutral perspective. 
________

Also, there is a difference if someone has experience in blogging before or not. Some people get the first time in touch with blogging through this platform. But the question is what would be the best posting frequency to get the most out of Steemit right?
________

This question includes effort you have to do. We all have! Surely in a way that you can make it, but you have to put an effort in it. From this point, I want to try to answer this questions.

![As a beginner.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmb7BCYYMhMrzHp3UwLqRC3agx6jqGwQtAfJEyLrMKiqZW/As%20a%20beginner.png)

I would definitely recommend making a sprint first, not a marathon. This would mean trying to post in a short time many contributions. 

If you are not familiar with blogging, I would say trying to post every second or third day. Better every second. 

Why should you start with a sprint?
To get more exposure, people start getting to know you. If they see you constantly posting even, if your rewards may not be like in your imagination, your name is getting out in this community. And this is the first important step.
__________

After you have made your sprint, you need to change your strategy to a marathon, because Steemit is a marathon. So every athlete has his own strategy for a marathon, but one is for sure. They try to keep their speed equal to the distance they have to run. 

One important goal running a marathon is to reach the end. No one is interested if you reached the highest speed of all competitors but on the half you are finished.

![Someone who is.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmcGN5VZJWn3asEqeRTJ3eD4QW7FcaBz587hGermvDdFrn/Someone%20who%20is.png)

I assume now that people who are already longer here got more familiar with blogging. I know that there are people who comment more as they write posts but the focus right now is on posting frequency. I don't consider those people right now. Also not the posting quality, but this is also for another contribution.
___________

So what is exactly the best posting frequency for those people? 
___________

In my opinion, with the goal to get the most out of this community, this includes more exposure within the community, more connection with others, and more financial rewards.

And knowing that Steemit is a marathon, you need a long breath.
I would say the best post frequency would be once a day. At least every second day.

![Why is that?.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmPQMSjxYXWqgeTqxu4nmdigopaNa1Rnj1a6L7ppoYP3k8/Why%20is%20that%3F.png)

I honestly believe that the more consistent you are, the better the total output. See yourself as an apple? tree.

It takes time to grow and bear fruits. But between this time the seed need the required conditions to get to the point where it actually bears fruits. Without these circumstances, it will never get to the blessed point. Means no fruits, or in our place, never the rewards you expect. 

![What does an apple tree need.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmVjaLviekD8uGBNZrD9iWrwPYroS7sh1ryLciRN9p8kKJ/What%20does%20an%20apple%20tree%20need.png)

<center>![AppleTree_L1_Apple_S4.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmUSHjMUk4U4siPFHsXVdC8bnU9FZrXobZXpkNcXxyVJsM/AppleTree_L1_Apple_S4.png)</center>

First, the seed needs to experience cold temperatures. This is like building a fundament to grow. Let us say that these cold temperatures are your thoughts if you can make it. You are questioning yourself, you are not sure if you have the skills to become one day a whale for example. Or to make a living out of Steemit.

This winter could also be other people attacking you, what we already saw here in this community.But the seed needs? to pass through this coldness. There are few things more for an apple seed to make sure it could grow to a big apple tree, but let's make a jump now.

![Sunlight.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmYoRdASonrm4Nujb5TKJ2PE76S7rFd3HsgptJUMsVRnTZ/Sunlight.png)

These three things the growing seed need consistently.

Without them, it cant grow to bear fruits. When the tree is small, it needs help to grow, but if it reached one day, a certain height nature would make the rest, in our case Steemit dynamics are taking control. 

You see, more comments, more upvotes, higher financial rewards, what motivates you to go forward and you are growing and growing until the fruits are coming. 

![See yourself as apple tree.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmUHdk1e8iMMxvryjmb9pvaaN6bsLTJ9gmKNNhauQnqJSz/See%20yourself%20as%20apple%20tree.png)

To get there, it needs consistent conditions. Posting frequency is one of them. But as I said you cant generalize it or make a doctrine about it, also it's not guaranteed that you will bear fruits. But if you don't do the required first steps you destroy your chance at the very beginning.

To grow takes time never forget that.

I believe once a day at least every second day is a beneficial frequency for this steemit marathon if you want to get the most out of it.  Yes, you can do more of course, but watch yourself not to burn out. I am doing this not myself. Now in the holidays I have the capacity and try to post every day, but when during the preparation for the next half of the season it will be difficult, but that's totally fine for me. You have also to be ok with your decision.

What I shared with you I am not doing myself but nevertheless, I am convinced that this could be a beneficial way to grow during this Steemit marathon.
____________

By the way, you know what the best thing is when the apple tree is fully grown and is bearing fruits?

Other are enjoying the fruits **YOU** produced.

![Fotolia_121063996_Subscription_Monthly_M.jpg](https://steemitimages.com/DQmV35NMA5ECHpCqTHJGx4T4tRHr2AqMmPb5CjY8Lmxay9p/Fotolia_121063996_Subscription_Monthly_M.jpg)

![Follow Upvote resteem png.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmU6C6NQ5wAwy3mpVBqTVp7oQeLadkJQbEy4p8Bsk7ktj4/Follow%20Upvote%20resteem%20png.png)

0.root_title: Show Me Your Passion! Get A Chance For A 100% Upvote!
0.body:
![show me your passion.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmSWxWeBfkYEa2FUrex7gotxXqWkgFSeHpYPyEPeDE1QUy/show%20me%20your%20passion.png)

Sometimes it's hard to get the attention to valuable contributions on Steemit.
I am trying to follow Steemains I found interesting but even then I am missing often great posts or they are going down in my feed. I know that I could look with more effort, but when I am writing I totally forget it.

Some of you shared already in the comment section some posts they made and found it could be matching to one of my posts. I really like that because then I definitely know about your contribution. 

That's why I am doing this here:
_________________

![Show me your passion text.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmRvF7jDbY8PjZ6eHT5KezyvjHDiN9YdduxzayFQH5UDK7/Show%20me%20your%20passion%20text.png)
 
We all have a passion for something and mostly we are writing about that here on our blog.
Show me this passion if you want. Share your link in the comment section and describe in 1-2 sentences what your contribution is about.

**One of the shared links will get a 100% upvote from me.**

Please be aware of following things:
__________

**I am not promising to read every post. No, that's why I said to describe your post in 1-2 sentences. I will look through it and what I​ find interesting I will read.** 

**You can share what you want about every topic, make sure that your passion is visible.** 
______________

Everyone can join. :)

I am hoping to see new exciting content here.

![Follow Upvote resteem png.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmU6C6NQ5wAwy3mpVBqTVp7oQeLadkJQbEy4p8Bsk7ktj4/Follow%20Upvote%20resteem%20png.png)

0.body:
![Finally Holidays.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmUcAxBaGQ26xVSha8NCSJJKa7Loqh5v9jkKASzdPwP89c/Finally%20Holidays.png)

The first half of the season is finally over and that means HOLIDAYS! Yeahhhhh! The last 6 months were really tough. Many games, injuries and of course the mental pressure. One thing I like in the winter holidays is that they are in the best family season. And I am relaxing now with my family here in Austria. Let me show you some pictures.
________

I heard that this place is called the Maldives of Austria? ;)

![LRG_DSC01827.JPEG](https://steemitimages.com/DQmQUmKh4CRsxxDY6jKewcAwFy3R4fXiU3VCtWpD8BKycfK/LRG_DSC01827.JPEG)

![LRG_DSC01828.JPEG](https://steemitimages.com/DQmWTMgVvU5WwAwc2ag8yNHwEoU2uTXmaFv1uhXjH1SJBXv/LRG_DSC01828.JPEG)

![LRG_DSC01835.JPEG](https://steemitimages.com/DQmYEhuCPoj5dangng8mF5vGcCyRadmK6t1bqoYkqJMUx4S/LRG_DSC01835.JPEG)

![LRG_DSC01823.JPEG](https://steemitimages.com/DQmVy8AL8T1adikwea4vX35LJ8WVpknknK34xbmHutHzzw4/LRG_DSC01823.JPEG)

![LRG_DSC01834.JPEG](https://steemitimages.com/DQmUdJj5uPd8q8EkGFj4HubXdD2pq24Gp3EmmUt6rCxFKbm/LRG_DSC01834.JPEG)

This place is really awesome. Austria is surprising me again. 
I am so glad to have this time to relax and to tank up. But this post is not only to show how good I have it.

______

But also to be thankful in these times to have the possibility to have a holiday like that.
To be thankful for every possibility we have.

0.root_title: Nach langer Zeit mein erster deutscher Vorstellungspost! Ray Yabo aka @modernpastor!
0.body:
![Modernpastor deutsch.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmUe89oPiAdB6a17FqiGNr1CPp5BPKmdKMHTVHzuo2Lpwq/Modernpastor%20deutsch.png)

Ich weiß, ich weiß, ich bin sicherlich kein Neuling hier in dieser Community, oder Minnow, wenn wir uns das Steemit Vokabular zunutze machen.

Im Gegenteil, ich glaube aktuell wäre ich entweder ein großer Delphin, oder kleiner Wahl. Egal, darum geht es jetzt eh nicht. Doch, wieso jetzt einen Vorstellungspost, wenn ich schon etwas länger dabei bin, fragst du dich vielleicht.
___________

Nun, der liebe Martin aka @theaustrianguy hatte mich vor paar Tagen gefragt, ob ich jemals einen deutschen Vorstellungspost geschrieben hatte. Anfangs war ich mir nicht ganz sicher, bis sich selbst nachgesehen habe und tatsächlich, hatte ich nur einen auf Englisch geschrieben. 
___________

Da empfahl mir Martin, auch wenn schon eine Zeit vergangen ist, einen kompletten deutschen Beitrag zu schreiben. Als nämlich am letzten Mittwoch ein Steemit Meetup in München stattfand, kannten mich einige deutsche User gar nicht. Daher möchte ich die Gelegenheit nutzen um mich auch der deutsch sprechenden Community vorzustellen, ich hoffe das nimmt mir niemand böse.

![Wer bin ich?.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmPSJwV5UyXwnKXmzN4R5HfHKpzVSA4necgwCdA4pQpXpi/Wer%20bin%20ich%3F.png)

Mein Name Reinhold Yabo, die meisten nennen mich aber Ray aka @modernpastor hier auf Steemit.
Ich bin 25 Jahre alt und vom Beruf her bin ich Berufssportler, Profifußballer aktuell beim FC Redbull Salzburg in Österreich.
Auf Steemit bin ich nun seit August 2017.
___________

Damals bin ich durch einen Podcast, frag mich nicht mehr von wem, eher gesagt der Interviewpartner hatte das dezentrale Netzwerk, auf Blockhain Basis erwähnt, dass die Autoren, für ihre Beiträge honoriert. Ich dachte mir: „**Was, das gibt es wirklich?**“
__________

Als ich dann aktiv gesucht habe, bin ich auf Steemit gestoßen.
Es hat nicht lange gedauert und ich habe mir einen Account angelegt.

Alles was du meinst über Fußballprofis zu wissen, werfe über Bord, denn ich erfülle dieses Klischee bei weitem nicht.
Die Welt betitelte mich als den“ungewöhnlichsten Fußballprofi“ Deutschlands.
Das liegt einfach daran, dass ich neben dem Fußball auch noch andere Interessen habe, darunter z. B. das Schreiben.
___________

Ich verfüge über eine langjährige Bloggervergangenheit, damals hauptsächlich, über meine eigene Homepage. Dort habe ich überwiegend, für meine Fans geschrieben, ein bisschen ausführlicher als immer diese standardisierte Interviewkost.
In dieser Zeit habe ich, bei der Schule des Schreibens einen Kurs für"Kreatives Schreiben" belegt, um meine Schreibfähigkeiten zu verbessern.
____________

Zeitgleich habe ich mich aber auch für Unternehmertum interessiert, speziell im Bereich online-business. Mein erster Versuch, war ein typisches Affiliate Projekt, ich glaube damit fangen die Meisten an. :D

Dann gab es bei mir auch kurz eine politische Laufbahn, als in Karlsruhe gespielt hatte. Aber da bin ich wirklich nur rein gestolpert :D

![1235166_artikel-text_1oD6PA_gol7sa.jpg](https://steemitimages.com/DQmZsLWDdpDL3TCuDEHBk7KQSpHkkCoQSCwCHAbg1uyv3SV/1235166_artikel-text_1oD6PA_gol7sa.jpg)
________

Seit Steemit beschäftige ich nun vermehrt mit Cryptowährungen, was ich sehr spannend finde. Auch da probiere ich einiges aus, wenn du verstehst was ich meine. ;)
Generell liebe ich es neue Dinge auszuprobieren.

![Worüber ich schreibe.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmXGFe8AmZuX3uNTxYTS8c4pkjpRG2WHNpsqCW6J7nTTn8/Wor%C3%BCber%20ich%20schreibe.png)

Ich schreibe hauptsächlich auf Englisch.
In meinem Blog, wirst du unter anderem Beiträge, über Persöhnlichkeitsentwicklung, Life-Coaching und Empowerment finden. 

Dazu veranstalte ich ab und zu einige Herausforderungen, gerade läuft auch einer der „**Steemian des Jahres**“ Explizit habe ich bisher nicht ausführlich über Sport, oder dem Fußballprofi Dasein geschrieben, einfach weil ich dieses Klischee nicht bedienen will. Zumindest nicht am Anfang. Darüber schreiben, werde ich definitiv noch.
________

Ich freue mich immer auf neue Bekanntschaften, bis hierhin, konnte ich schon einige tolle machen.
Ich wünsche jedem, dass er seine persönlichen, und beruflichen Ziele erreichen möge. Diese Plattform hat das Zeug dazu viele Leben zu verändern.

Reinhold „Ray“ Yabo aka @modernpastor

0.root_title: You Are Earning More Money Than You Think! My Steemian Of The Year Contribution!
0.body:
![You are earning more.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmbtJeCg4VDTfawXxA3VWkDDEJQVCmwGmAFGNM8D9L1y4C/You%20are%20earning%20more.png)

Did you already take notice of my **Steemit Of The Year Challenge**? If you want to participate, you can check the first post about it by clicking on the thumbnail. 
________

<center>[![Steemian of the year small.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmfUihowXa4vMf86yhdJMyCht8AARYWa3nPKNg5GhdohRx/Steemian%20of%20the%20year%20small.png)](https://steemit.com/steemianoftheday/@modernpastor/who-is-your-steemian-of-the-year-join-this-challenge)</center>
________

I will take this opportunity to write about my **Steemian Of The Year**. But let me tell you that I met many awesome people here and I hope and think to meet more in the future.
__________

My **Steemian Of The Year** is @theaustrianguy.
The aspiring doctor who wants to make the world a better place his bio says.

The challenge includes telling others why the person you chose is your Steemian of the Year.

![I will tell you why.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmSHe9Nz8eXwkCpgfkSf5LLKY1KnVUwQ3MEPmoP4b5DMpA/I%20will%20tell%20you%20why.png)

I joined Steemit back in August 2017.
My **Steemian Of The Year** was from my very beginning in contact with me. Showing me how this community works and he was really interested in my profession ;) 

Ok, this is something that is not new to me but believe me guys during my years as a professional football player I got a sense if someone is really interested in me or does he want to be my friend, because of that what I am doing. 

I felt his interest was pure, as from many others here. For me the first time I experienced it in that way on a social media platform. 
____________

My **Steemian Of The Year** even came to a game from me, first, I was thinking he was joking, but he truly did. I didn't see him, but I read his post he made about this game. If you are interested, you can read it here:
__________

<center>[![DQmemVNh4Pxq24NfG4jr2gwbzD9BiGspgCWUfeTtL8ur3Et.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmXquo4547biaMiWjijYdBnNjwsAW16m7DCWB1rs7toDnT/DQmemVNh4Pxq24NfG4jr2gwbzD9BiGspgCWUfeTtL8ur3Et.png)](https://steemit.com/sports/@theaustrianguy/an-epic-soccer-game-with-the-mvp-being-a-steemian)</center>
________

**My Steemian Of The Year**  is really kind, social and helpful. And I profited again from him what I want to share with you guys. I am sure some of you will benefit from it.
___________

From the very beginning, I had set my payout rewards to 100% power up. 

I didn't notice that the steem dollar increased. And from this point of view, it would be stupid to power up 100% instead splitting the reward into 50/50. Guys, your actual payouts are right now more worth as you may think. It takes a second look for it.
_________

My **Steemian Of The Year** drew my attention to it, telling me to change it for my good.
He made a fantastic video about it which explained it simple.
I highly recommend it to watch it on Dtube.
__________

All in all, I am pleased to met someone like that and as I said in the beginning, I have met a lot of amazing people here, but the challenge says that only one could be chose as **Steemian Of The Year.**Everything else would be too easy ;)

I would appreciate if you would join :)

Here the Video:

[DTube](https://d.tube/v/theaustrianguy/db0silea)
_______

0.root_title: You Don't Want To Regret That!
0.body:
![You dont want to regret that.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmcejQQnr4tcc3KfDEauRk8UU5sGyMm9ydbPx5VR5msCJB/You%20dont%20want%20cryptocurrencyhat.png)

Steem, SBD, and the whole cryptocurrency world are flying right now. Price increases, opportunities to invest, when it comes to cryptocurrency on Steemit you feel the spirit of optimism, and that's great. I hope for the whole steem ecosystem that it will grow much more and became an enormous tree.

![big-trees-wallpaper-1.jpg](https://steemitimages.com/DQmYzKppp7MXmxusB6me41epWeUJSi8kcRQxBgUhDEbnMGR/big-trees-wallpaper-1.jpg)

Imagine that the whole steem ecosystem will reach one day the weight of current global players like Youtube, or Facebook and you was into it from the very beginning. What a blessing.
_________

But I want to talk about something different. 
Inspired by a youtube content creator called travel feels.
I know this youtuber from his beginnings, mostly talking about filmmaking and photography. He has made a rapid ascent in the youtube community.
__________

In his last videos, he spoke about something essential, at least in my opinion.

People are looking for chances, and opportunities, to hustle to their dreams, living their dreams. And we all know that this way is a tough one. Many tears are shed, and not everyone will make it.
____________

Even in the Cryptocurrency space, not everyone will make it. Be glad to be involved at an early stage.

But there are things in life you don't want to regret. It doesn't matter where you are standing vocational. **There are areas you don't want to regret!** 
__________

But let me tell you this. Especially in good running days, these​ things are quickly forgotten until we crash back to the ground knowing that Youtube, Dtube, Steemit, Bitcoin, Litecoin whatever can't help us.

Am I saying these things are wrong? Of course not. Far away with that. Go your way and take the chance to fulfill your dreams but...
______________

Don't forget the simplicity of life. Don't forget to kiss your wife, to honor her, to hug your children, to celebrate with friends and to say goodbye when you are leaving. When you are going out make sure your lovely ones know that you love them.

Even when you reached all your goals, it will mean nothing when you cant share it.
If you are interested you can watch the video below.

<iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/cdgqWOqnacY" frameborder="0" gesture="media" allow="encrypted-media" allowfullscreen></iframe>

I wish you all a nice Sunday​. :)

0.root_title: 1 Way How You Can Overcome Unexpected Fear![Extended]
0.body:
![How to overcome.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmc9erCXv7PyTkV19DiBgRFRKeEBdMn8MALTx9wn5vK4eQ/How%20to%20overcome.png)

Time to pastor again. :)

Today I want to share with you **How You Could Overcome Unexpected Fear** in a short time.
Well, I have to clarify that I am not talking about fear in general, rather than when it's facing us in our profession.
________

Last week in the last international game against Marseille we played the first time a new system. A formation we never played and trained before.

Also, we were already qualified for the next round that's why the result of the game wouldn't affect anything. But as Athletes, you always try to win. But not only as an athlete I think every one of us in our profession or personal life we want and try to succeed. 
___________

But then how life is playing his game with us, unexpected moments happen. We are confronted with situations we never faced before. They are scaring us; our mind is having a lot of pictures showing us our bad ending. Our heart is going to beat faster and faster because we are not confident that we can overcome this fear or that we would deliver the results we want, we need, or our boss demands.
____________

On this day I was sitting on the bench. I thought that he would not put me inside this day because I played the game before. But it seems that our Coach was not happy with the manner we were playing. He sends me to warm up, and after five minutes he called me back. I was surprised.
_____________

I thought: "Ok, maybe he wants more quality :D."
In my mind, I was already going through some movements on my position. Regular stuff! But then something unexpected happened.

The Coach asks me if I could play a totally different position. 
Like a pistol, I asked: *What? Serious?"*
____________

My heart started to beat harder because I never played the position he planned to change me in before. After a long time in my life, I was feeling unsure; I didn't know how the movements on this position are, the space between the lines. The coach asked me again:" *You think you can play this?*"
_________

I had not much time to think deeply about If I can or not.
I needed a way to get to an answer I can trust on quickly.

And this is what I want to share with you.
The method I used is called....

![Heuristics.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmVba6V427SJVdRPpZ6HYEpjKheovfj4Sz3Jy4ED2TnBz1/Heuristics.png)

For those who don't know what heuristic is:

**It's a process where you get with minimal pieces of information to the right solution quickly. The outcome might not be perfect, but like I said before its a much easier way to get the right answer or solution.**

The heuristic is wide preamble which is split into smaller specific areas.

What I used at that moment is called **gaze heuristic**

Wikipedia defines gaze heuristic that way:
_________
<center>*The gaze heuristic is a heuristic used in directing correct motion to achieve a goal using one main variable.[1] An example of the gaze heuristic is catching a ball. The gaze heuristic is one example of psychologist Gerd Gigerenzer's one good reason heuristic, where humans and animals are able to process large amounts of information quickly and react, regardless of whether the information is consciously processed.[2]*</center>

<center>*The gaze heuristic is a critical element in animal behavior, being used in predation heavily.[3] At the most basic level, the gaze heuristic ignores all casual relevant variables to make quick gut reactions.*</center>
_________

Here a picture for a better imagination.

![Fangen-eines-Balles-1024x749.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmX5oLrahpwTpWLFMucY5AhMz5Dht2RNP1yHcLqVSASmeb/Fangen-eines-Balles-1024x749.png)
<center>*( How can the Baseball player summon where the ball is falling. To make a complete math he has definitely not the time. But he doesn't need all these information. He keeps his sight constantly the same angle to the ball. Doing that he is able to catch the ball and this is the goal.)*</center>

In my situation, it was not exactly like the Wikipedias definition, because I? didn't need to catch a ball.
Let's go back to the answer I gave the coach and let me explain to you why I said **YES, I can.**
__________

Before my spiritual eye, I was seeing the player who played until now in this position. And I know the size of the pitch. I had scenes in my head, where the player was standing on the pitch in the most important situation. Means I had enough fresh information I could use. That's why I said **yes** nevertheless with a dull feeling in my stomach, but I knew it could work.  

![Xy5Nlwl.jpg](https://steemitimages.com/DQmcU1xfvLjYXZkXYEbugwv6JMgFQ2nqeeY1cuif1my8PYU/Xy5Nlwl.jpg)
___________

This process happened not instantly. No, with every second I was scanning his movements in my head.  For example, how was he standing when the ball was on the other side. I was even not in the game, and the process was running and running. And also during the game, this process was running inside of me. With more time I got a better feeling because I try to copy his movements on this position.

But this could not have been possible if I had not these kinds of information. In other words, if I had not followed? the game carefully it would be much much harder for me to deliver a solid performance.
___________

And with this technique, I played a position I never played before, with a dull feeling quite well.

**Yes, I played it quite well.**
_______

I think without this method I would have? had no confidence to try it. 
And therefore I would have missed the chance to play against a well-known club. I wouldn't have made this experience that brought me one step further.

![Transfer it.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmXAiLZwgpvvW67yoxESXtKJT5vwCMGgLR3xh4jho8UHUp/Transfer%20it.png)

More information doesn't mean better results. And again I am not generalizing. But I am talking about a specific situation where you don't have time to prepare yourself adequately. The heuristic can be an answer. 

Read carefully! **I said can be, not will be.**
During my life, I made good experience using this method, and I can recommend it to you.

You can find a proper solution even with limited information. With this limited information, you are able to make good decisions. You don't need to know everything when you focus on some I call them Key rules.

When your boss demands something you never did before, you don't need to panic. You don't have to be a master in that certain field. Is there anywhere information you can use? Maybe you watched your workmate doing it, or you read a book about it. You are able to get a solution with limited information. It could be a way to overcome unexpected fear ​because you are able to find a solution.


![Follow Upvote resteem png.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmU6C6NQ5wAwy3mpVBqTVp7oQeLadkJQbEy4p8Bsk7ktj4/Follow%20Upvote%20resteem%20png.png)
